programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: BBC One joins the BBC's rolling news channel for a night of news.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The latest news, sport, business and weather from the BBC's Breakfast team.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker introduces highlights and analysis of seven Premier League games, including title-chasing Manchester City's clash with relegation-threatened Leicester. The defending champions are locked in a two-way battle for the title with Arsenal, while the visitors are enduring a difficult campaign at the wrong end of the table under manager Brendan Rodgers. Elsewhere, Southampton host Crystal Palace in another fight for survival, while Everton continue their own quest to stay up against Fulham, who are managed by former Toffees boss Marco Silva.

programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures.

programme.title: Celebration Kitchen
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt hosts a special edition of the BBC's live cookery show in celebration of Eid al-Fitr. Special guests DJ and producer Naughty Boy, model Mariah Idrissi and actor and presenter Islah Abdur-Rahman all share their favourite Eid traditions. There are brilliant dishes to cook for the festival as well as ideas for dishes to break the fast in the last week of Ramadan, including recipes from Mursal Sarq, Dr Saliha Mahmood Ahmed and Fozia Ismail.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S24 (35/80)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Blackpool, Derby and Bilston.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt S49
programme.desc: Eric Knowles leads today's proceedings from Newbury. Caroline Hawley and David Harper are the experts helping the reds and blues spend £300 on three items within an hour. Eric also finds out how Newbury was once home to the world's largest peace camp.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Songs of Praise (Faith and Philanthropy) (n°3)
programme.desc: «Faith and Philanthropy»Aled Jones visits Bournville to explore the faith and philanthropy of the Cadbury family.

programme.title: Aston Villa / Chelsea
programme.desc: Watch live coverage as Aston Villa take on Chelsea in the Women's FA Cup semi-finals.

programme.desc: «Ocean»David Attenborough explores our mysterious seas and reveals dramatic wildlife stories.

programme.title: Countryfile

programme.title: Our Changing Planet S2 (1/2)
programme.desc: Six presenters meet the people fighting to rebalance earth's failing ecosystems.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona and the team return to the glorious grounds of Aston Hall in Birmingham.

programme.title: Great Expectations S1 (4/6)
programme.desc: As Pip learns to navigate London life alongside Jaggers, Estella battles with her future.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international news from the BBC.

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman brings you the best of the action from Sunday's Premier League games as title hopefuls Arsenal take on struggling West Ham United in a London derby. Arsenal are aiming to win the title for the fourth time in the Premier League era. They have won six of the last seven meetings with their opponents, including a 3-1 home victory on Boxing Day, while the Hammers have defeated their visitors just once in the last eight years. In today's other contest, Manchester United travelled to take on Nottingham Forest, having already beaten them three times in all competitions this season.
